titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Economic Development, Office Files of Millard Owens
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Economic Development, Office Files of Millard Owens FA512

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 15:42:58 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Economic Development, Office Files of Millard Owens

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Millard "Mitty" Owens is a nonprofit executive in the field of community development. He joined the Ford Foundation in 1998 and worked for several years as a Program Officer in its Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Economic Development unit.

Owens' post-Ford Foundation career has included his position as an Adjunct Professor at the New York University Wagner School of Public Policy from 2007-2009. He then founded Community Impact Consulting. Later, he served as a Process Facilitator at EmcArts and as a Program Director of Confluence Philanthropy. In 2020, he became Director of the Capital Strategies Program at Transform Finance.
Owens completed his undergraduate education at Yale University and earned an M.S. in community economic development from New Hampshire College (now Southern New Hampshire University).
